Contrary to reports, Thomas Müller‘s suspension is yet to be decided. He will serve atleast a one match ban, missing the game at Anfield.

He may also miss the 2nd leg, if his challenge on Nicolas Tagliafico is deemed a ’serious offence‘ at a UEFA hearing on January 10th. #LFC

Roberto Firmino has hailed Jurgen Klopp as he labels playing at Liverpool a ‘joyful experience.’

The Brazilian has once more been integral to the Reds this term as they lead the Premier League and praised his manager to the club website.

“Playing for him is a really joyful experience,” the Brazilian said. “Firmino told Liverpool’s website. ‘I love it, as do the rest of the team.

“We’ve learned so much from him since he arrived and we’ve only got better. He is what you see in public: the passion, the father figure.

“And he’s also got ambition to win titles and give his best and, as players, we can only win with what we learn from him.

“I hope that we can achieve something soon but we are just starting out. There is a lot of football still to play.”
